name: 柯明村
objective:
本課程主要包含四部份，分別為基本有限差分法、流體力學與熱傳方程式的有限差分法應用、有限體積法、格點產生法。
This course comprises four parts. Part one is fundamentals of finite-difference methods. Part 2 is the application of finite-difference methods to the equations of fluid mechanics and heat transfer. Part 3 is finite-volume method. Part 4 is grid generation.
schedule:
1	Introduction to CFD

2	The Equations of CFD
       (1) Governing equations of fluid flow and heat transfer
       (2)  Conservative form of the governing equations of fluid flow
       (3) Differential and integral form of the general transport equations
       (4) Classification of physical behaviour
       (5) Classification method for simple partial differential equations

3	Turbulence and its Modelling----Refer: FLUENT UG Chap.10 and Powerpoint
       (1) Characteristics of simple turbulent flows
       (2) Turbulence models
       Mixing length model	
       The k-ε models
       Reynolds stress equation models
       Algebraic stress equation models
       Some recent advances

4	The Solution Methods----Refer: FLUENT UG Chap.5, Chap.22
       (1) Grids—Structured, Unstructured
       (2) Discritization Methods—Finite Difference Method and Finite Volume Method
       (3) Pressure-Velocity Coupling—SIMPLE, SIMPLER, SIMPLEC, PISO

5	Boundary Conditions----Refer: FLUENT UG Chap.6
       (1) Inlet	
       (2) Outlet
       (3) Wall boundary conditions	
       (4) Constant pressure
       (5) Periodic or cyclic		
6	The Finite Volume Method for Convection-Diffusion Problems
       (1) The central differencing scheme
       (2) Properties of discretisation schemes
       Conservativeness, Boundedness and Transportiveness
       (3) The upwind scheme	
       (4) The hybrid scheme
       (5) The power-law scheme	
       (6) Higher order schemes
       (7) Other higher order schemes	
       (8) Unsteady flows
7	Solution algorithms for pressure-velocity coupling flows
       (1) The staggered grid
       (2) The momentum equations
       (3) The SIMPLE algorithm	
       (4) Assembly of a complete method
       (5) The SIMPLER algorithm	
       (6) The SIMPLEC algorithm
       (7) The PISO algorithm	
       (8) The hybrid scheme
8	Engineering Examples
scorePolicy:
平時成績：點名未到一次扣 5 分	
Final Exam. 6/19 (一)	----- 50% 
Presentation	------------- 20%	
Technical Report	--------- 30%
materials:
H. K. Versteeg and W. Malalasekera, An introduction to computational fluid dynamics-The finite volume method, Longman Scientific & Technical.
References:J.  C.  Tannehill,  D.  A.  Anderson  and  R.  H.  Pletcher,  Computational  Fluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer, 2nd Ed., Taylor&Francis.
